tweet: Following the tour, @Rep_Watkins and I hosted a flood forum in Highland, where nearly 100 people came to ask questions about the flooding. pic.twitter.com/sqdbLVG6vn

From Four State Lookout, you could see how widespread the flooding is in NE Kansas, Missouri, Nebraska and Iowa. pic.twitter.com/h7MaMmS3o4

I was joined by Colonel Douglas Guttormsen, Commander of the @KC_USACE, David Schemm, FSA State Executive Director and Doniphan County producers for a flood tour in White Cloud. pic.twitter.com/76uMWBoAFj
I enjoyed visiting with friends and constituents today at a town hall meeting in Oskaloosa. We discussed agriculture, flooding, health care and trade. pic.twitter.com/epEIT6nTXP

This afternoon, I sent a letter to @realDonaldTrump with this request. The road to recovery will be long, but with the efforts of our first responders coupled with your help we will be able to overcome. I urge @realdonaldtrump to swiftly add the counties impacted by last night's tornadoes to the federal disaster declaration.

 https://www.ksn.com/news/local/seven-counties-added-to-disaster-declaration/2036947040 …

I'm glad to see @realDonaldTrump approved the Kansas Disaster Declaration and ordered federal assistance for counties experiencing devastating flooding throughout the state. pic.twitter.com/2bbGsvRyoj
Many areas in Kansas are experiencing severe weather, including tornadoes and strong thunderstorms. Please stay safe.
Honored to speak at the @FortRiley Memorial Day ceremony this afternoon. pic.twitter.com/29ymdKVr92

On #MemorialDay we honor the brave men and women who have paid the ultimate sacrifice defending our freedom. Let us remember the true meaning of today and steadfastly remember our heroes. pic.twitter.com/LNb3s4U9Pa

Thank you to our first responders and emergency management officials for all their hard work. Please remain vigilant and heed the orders of local and state officials as adverse weather conditions worsen.

Communities across Kansas are feeling the effects of saturated soils and above average rainfall, as floodwaters are affecting many in our state and region. I have been in contact with the @USACEHQ and @KansasEmergency who are monitoring conditions in Kansas.

Today, on #NationalMissingChildrensDay we remember Kelsey Smith who was abducted in broad daylight from an Overland Park department store and murdered. This recently released documentary shows why we must pass the Kelsey Smith Act:  https://www.investigationdiscovery.com/tv-shows/hometown-homicide-local-mysteries/full-episodes/kelsey-smith … @KSFTIPS pic.twitter.com/CEtc316GJC

Today is a good day for consumers. The Senate passed, with my support, legislation that will crack down on robocall fraudsters and block deceptive calls that have bombarded just about every single person I know. Read more here:
 https://www.roberts.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/pressreleases?id=66C25122-BB34-44B3-8930-61E5126F3268 …
Next Thursday, @Rep_Watkins and I will be holding a flood forum in Highland. Representatives from the @USACEHQ and @USDA will be on site to answer your questions. pic.twitter.com/5jxAt8Jpqo

I am monitoring the storms and flooding in Kansas, have been in touch with the @USACEHQ and am working closely with them to offer assistance at the federal level. In the meantime, stay safe and don't drive through flooded areas. pic.twitter.com/eY4xJdnf6r

Today, I introduced the VACCINES Act, along with @SenGaryPeters and @SenDuckworth, to increase vaccination rates by raising vaccine awareness through a national campaign to combat misinformation. pic.twitter.com/eBpuEklW1z
